interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Secret Garden (Hallmark Hall of Fame)
Review Date: 2016/06/03
Store: Gennie James  (Actor),     Barret Oliver  (Actor),     Alan Grint  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
Product Description: ['Product description', "Well-loved TV adaptation of Frances Hodgson Burnett's novel.", 'Amazon.com', "Mary Lennox (Gennie James) is a spoiled young British girl orphaned by an Indian epidemic. She is sent to Misselthwaite Manor in Yorkshire to live with a distant relative, Archibald Craven (Derek Jacobi), and there she becomes obsessed with a secret, overgrown garden. With the help of a local boy, Dickon, the garden and everyone around them--including Craven and his frail son, Colin--come to life again. Filmed on location at scenic Highclere Castle in Newbury, this Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation of Frances Hodgson Burnett's classic won an Emmy for Outstanding Children's Program. Although it can't top the 1949 version with Margaret O'Brien (or Agnieszka Holland's 1993 version), younger viewers may prefer this more straightforward retelling, whereas adults are sure to appreciate the fine performances by Jacobi and Billie Whitelaw (Mrs. Medlock). Colin Firth (", "Bridget Jones's Diary", ') appears briefly as the adult Colin in this timeless, uplifting story for all ages.', '--Kathleen C. Fennessy']
Average Rating: 4.8

profile:
**User Summary:**

The user continues to showcase a strong affinity for classic and family-friendly content, particularly in the drama genre, highlighted by affection for adaptations of literary classics. Their latest purchase reflects an appreciation for well-crafted narratives that connect emotionally with audiences of all ages. The user seems to favor high-quality productions that deliver both entertainment and cultural significance, evident in their preference for formats that offer enhanced audio-visual experiences, although this recent interaction deviated slightly by being a DVD rather than their typical Blu-ray choice.

The user exhibits a consistent tendency to rate films highly, particularly those that evoke nostalgia, uplift, and resonate with family themes. Their excitement for renowned actors and quality storytelling aligns with an interest in productions that feature strong performances and esteemed directors. While they maintain a preference for 5-star rated films, their enjoyment of diverse formats and adaptations indicates a willingness to explore various interpretations of beloved tales.

Overall, the user values artistry in film production and cherishes cinematic works that create emotional connections, reflecting a broader passion for enriching home entertainment experiences. They appreciate content that offers a blend of nostalgia and quality, blending both classic and contemporary elements within their collection.
